disp-quote.p: On the 6 th day at the beginning of the 2 nd month of 1734 (Yongzheng 24), the Grand Minister Haiwang (? –1755) gave the following imperial order: ‘According to what the consort Cering [1672 –1750] [ 97] has memorialized, balsam oil is extremely useful in the army; You should take care of (provisioning us) with this oil, the more the better, and store it in tin bottles, which are (normally) used as tea caddies, in order to make it into solid packages, and then take them all to Cering, the emperor’s son-in-law, for his disposal (of it to the army). This was endorsed. On the 9 th day of the same month, the manager of the Bureau of Provisions prepared 20 jin of balsam oil that was stored in 20 large and 4 small tin bottles as well as in 16 tea tin bottles at the palace workshop, in total more than 40 bottles.
